articles.title: Apple at all-time high after Morgan Stanley calls stock 'top pick' for AI efforts
articles.summary: Apple's shares reached a record high after Morgan Stanley named the stock a "top pick," citing the company's AI efforts as a significant boost to device sales. The investment bank raised its price target for Apple to $273 from $216, anticipating nearly 500 million iPhone sales over the next two years due to demand for its new Apple Intelligence features. This move positions Apple to capitalize on the growing interest in GenAI-enabled smartphones, even as its market share slightly declined.

articles.title: Apple signs on to voluntary US scheme to manage AI risks, White House says
articles.summary: Apple Inc. has joined President Joe Biden's voluntary commitments for artificial intelligence, becoming the 16th company to agree to manage AI risks. These commitments aim to ensure that AI's power is not used for destructive purposes. Other major firms like Google, Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, and Nvidia had previously signed on to the scheme.

articles.title: Apple Vision Pro Launches New Lake-Setting Environment For Digital Crown VR
articles.summary: Apple Vision Pro has enhanced its Digital Crown virtual reality feature by introducing a new lake-setting environment, featuring Norway's Lake Vrangla. This new environment offers a serene foggy view, a calming sunset scene, and reflective water for displayed videos. Apple also announced visionOS 2 will add a Bora Bora environment later this year, transforming 2D images into 3D.

articles.title: US to award Amkor up to $400 million for chip packaging plant
articles.summary: The U.S. Commerce Department plans to award Amkor Technology up to $400 million in grants to fund its $2 billion advanced semiconductor packaging facility in Arizona. This plant will be the largest of its kind in the U.S., with Apple as its first major customer for chips refined at a nearby TSMC facility. The award is part of a larger $39-billion subsidy program aimed at boosting U.S. semiconductor manufacturing and addressing the growing demand for AI chips.

articles.title: GoPlay Chinese - Kids Games by iHuman Inc.
articles.summary: GoPlay Chinese is an educational app by iHuman Inc. designed to make learning Chinese fun and engaging for children. It offers a comprehensive learning system packed with games, videos, activities, and books to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. The app boasts over 500 unique games, animated videos, daily speaking activities with instant feedback, exciting storybooks, and interactive characters, having helped more than 20 million children learn Chinese.

articles.title: Credit Card Prequalification Gives Control to the Consumers -...
articles.summary: The article discusses the increasing trend of credit card prequalification tools, which empower consumers by allowing them to check approval odds without a hard credit pull. These tools, offered by major issuers like Apple, Goldman Sachs, American Express, and Capital One, benefit both consumers by preventing wasted credit inquiries and issuers by reducing unqualified applications and maintaining brand favorability. Comscore data shows significant growth in the use of these tools, accounting for a substantial portion of digital credit card applications.

articles.title: AES Corp (AES) August 16 puts purchased as share price down 9.5%
articles.summary: AES Corp (NYSE: AES) saw significant options activity with 3500 contracts of August 16 puts purchased for 40c as its share price dropped 9.5%. The company's 30-day implied volatility is at 42, within its 52-week range of 25 to 87. This trading action suggests increased bearish sentiment or hedging activity around AES.

articles.title: This Vanguard ETF Is Tumbling as Big Tech Stocks Sink
articles.summary: The article discusses how a Vanguard ETF is experiencing a downturn due to the recent struggles of major technology stocks, specifically referencing the "Magnificent Seven." The author suggests that the market for tech investors is becoming more volatile.

articles.title: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sets, closes at record high
articles.summary: Berkshire Hathaway's Class A share price reached a new record high on Monday, closing up 2.1% at $652,997.17, reflecting strong investor confidence in Warren Buffett's company. The company's market value rose to approximately $937 billion, and its shares have gained 20% this year, outperforming the S&P 500. This milestone occurred despite a previous glitch on June 3 that erroneously showed an even higher record price.

articles.title: Check out OneStream's stock price (OS) in real time
articles.summary: OneStream Inc. (OS) stock closed at $17.74, down 1.77%, with its 52-week range between $16.51 and $31.61. The company, which provides an AI-enabled Digital Finance Cloud platform, has a market cap of $4.325 billion. Recent news includes analyst calls and a CFO transition plan.

articles.title: The AI Revolution Continues
articles.summary: This article examines the ongoing AI revolution through the lens of WisdomTree's AI & Innovation Fund (WTAI) and U.S. Quality Growth Fund (QGRW), highlighting investor behavior and performance attribution within the sector. It specifically focuses on the sustainability of Nvidia's share price given its significant exposure in QGRW, contrasting it with WTAI's broader AI company base. Potential market catalysts for the latter half of 2024 include new AI hardware and potential interest rate cuts.
